Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

Filter Api¶

Method call¶

All the functions that you can use to filter method calls are prefixed with mc_ .

C stuff¶

mc_is_c_function(function) Check if the function is a c function
mc_get_c_function_name(c_function) Get the function name of the c function
mc_c_function_has_any_name(c_function, names) Check if the given c function has any of the names specified by names.

Objective-C stuff¶

mc_is_objectivec_function(function) Check if the function is an objective c function
mc_has_objc_class(function) Check if the receiver of a message is an objective c class.
mc_get_objc_class(objc_function) Same as mc_has_objc_class but returns the objective c class.
mc_has_any_selector(function, selector_names) Check if the function has a Selector with one of the specified names or will be loaded via NSSelectorFromString(...).
mc_sel_via_nsselector_from_string(function, ...) Check if a Selector is loaded via the NSSelectorFromString function
mc_objc_class_with_any_name(objc_function, names) Check if the name of the objective c class equals any name of names.

FunctionInterface stuff¶

mc_has_format_string(function) Check if the function has a FormatString as any of its arguments.
mc_filter_method_call(iterable, func_list[, ...]) Run over the iterable structure and check if one of the specified function matches on any argument.
mc_is_function(function) Check if the function is a Function at all
mc_contains_imp_got(function, imp_got_name) Check if function has the imp_got_name as an any argument and is a subclass of ImpGot.
mc_function_has_arg_with_name(function, name) Check if the function contains an argument with the specified name.
mc_function_has_arg_with_exact_name(...[, ...]) Check if the function contains an argument with the specified exact_name.
mc_function_has_arg_with_subname(function, ...) Check if the function contains an argument with the specified subname.

Other stuff¶

mc_is_exploitable_log_func(function)

Method definition¶

All the functions that you can use to filter on a method definition are prefixed with md_

md_filter_method_defintion(msg_send[, ...]) Filter a method definition like e.g.
md_filter_category(msg_send[, selector, ...]) Filter a category.
md_is_static_category_method(function) Check if the category is static.
md_is_category(function) Check if function is a category
md_has_category_class(function) Check if the function has a CategoryClass
md_get_category_class(function) Get the category class.

ModelUtil¶

All the functions that you can use to check if something is of a certain class are prefixed with is_

is_c_function(c_function) Check if the given argument is a Function
is_sub(sub) Check if sub is a subroutine like e.g.
is_objc_function(objc_function) Check if objc_function is an objective-c function
is_msg_send(msg_send) Check if the given argument is a MsgSend
is_method_implementation(function) Check if the function is a MethodImplementation.
is_method_implementation_argument(arg) Check if the given argument is a MethodSelectorArgument

Imp stuff¶

is_imp_got(imp_got) Check for ImpGot
is_imp_stub(imp_stub) Check for ImpStub

Objective-C stuff¶

is_selector(selector) Check if the given argument is a Selector
is_objc_class(clazz) Check if the given argument is an ObjcClass
is_category_class(clazz) Check if the given argument is an CategoryClass
is_nsstring(string) Check if the string is a NSString
is_frameworkclass(arg) Check if the given argument is a framework class.
is_format_string(string) Check if the given string is a FormatString

C-Stuff¶

is_memcpy(arg) Check if argument is a memcpy()
is_c_format_string(c_format_string) Check if the given string is a CFormatString

Other¶

is_stackvar(stackvar) Check if the given argument is a StackVar
is_python_string(string) Check if the given string is a python string
is_number(int_val) Check if the given argument is a number
destination_not_initialized(val) Check if the destination of an objc_msgSend is not initialized (has 0 as value).
